instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: Macbook pro 2014 blue screen
threads.message:
Hi. 
I`ve got this macbook pro 2014 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A)
When I plug the charger I have a green light the fan is spinning. When I turn it on I have this blue screen. The only places where it have corrosion from water damage is the keyboard pad and the corner of the macbook where are batteries.
Any suggestion where to start?

threads.title: Macbook pro 2014 blue screen
threads.message:
No Title

sorry my bad it`s not blue. it look like the backlight is on but no imagine 
also theres no chime

threads.title: Macbook pro 2014 blue screen
threads.message: Remove SSD and do a PRAM reset. Wait for 30 seconds and see if the question mark starts blinking.

threads.title: Macbook pro 2014 blue screen
threads.message:
No Title

Fixed the problem the keyboard connector was corroded and some key was pressed during that. change the connector and test the macbook. Everything seams to be ok apart for the fans they are spinning at full speed. test with ASD and it give me the error in picture. any suggestions?

threads.title: Macbook pro 2014 blue screen
threads.message: Water damage around <CHIP>U5850</CHIP>, otherwise a bad trace, bad ball or bad GPU, this diode is inside GPU.....

threads.title: Macbook pro 2014 blue screen
threads.message: the <CHIP>U5850</CHIP> looks good no water in that area...should i reflow the gpu?

threads.title: Macbook pro 2014 blue screen
threads.message: does anyone know how to fix this problem?

threads.title: Macbook pro 2014 blue screen
threads.message: Do not reflow, just some flux and heat 150C, should be enough to clear crap under GPU.

threads.title: Macbook pro 2014 blue screen
threads.message:
No Title

I heated the GPU the error disappeared. After I heated I cleaned in ultrasonic. 
Now I have 2 errors one is:
ID0R duc in test 1 sensor reads within operating range 
IPBR Battery BM0N test 1 sensor reads within operating range

threads.title: Macbook pro 2014 blue screen
threads.message: Both come from <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, check sense resistor circuits. <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> both sides to 6259.
